text: "moving on & forgetting is much harder when you & your ancestors have been hurt & your trust violated countless times." in this  piece i discuss how we need to listen to our patients' experiences & the work we need to do to earn their trust.
thank you, that makes sense & also explains why pregnant women & children are told to stay >6ft away.

the vet says that when oscar comes home from his radioiodine treatment we must stay 3ft away for a week b/c he's giving off gamma radiation. but i thought gamma radiation travels quite far so i'm confused as to why 3ft is protective. any smart people know more about this?
i look forward to hearing your episode!
that is both rude and unnecessary. sorry you have to deal with that review.

this sounds very similar to the fun process i went through for my most recent irb survey submission. although the best part was when they argued that i should make the survey required b/c more data is better. i mean, i agree but that kind of negates the whole optional thing.
we're supposed to be doing our hair for zoom meetings? i'm just embracing the wild look.
i’m glad i’m not the only one! it was worse b/c with covid restrictions we couldn’t even take him in & get him settled. it’s taking a lot of restraint to not call them every hour to check in!

well, at least we got a laugh when we dropped him off today. the vet explained that cat radioiodine treatments had stricter regulations than human treatments b/c humans follow the directions of their doctors & cats don’t. we have very different experiences of humans.

i definitely underestimated how much worrying about this cat was going to distract me from working this week. based on the fact that he hasn’t left my side in a week, i think he knows he’s going to the kitty hospital tomorrow for his 4 day radioactive vacation.
just a general overview of types of harm reduction behavior.

as bad as the original publication is, i really appreciate how quickly medtwitter responded to this. i love that my timeline is currently filled with unapologetic pictures of physicians & physicians in training having fun & being comfortable in their bodies.

does anyone know if there are any good validated assessments of harm reduction activities? we are looking at both substance use harmreduction (e.g. naloxone acquisition) & sexual harm reduction (e.g. condom use). please & thank you!
oh yes, this helps me too. at bedtime i've been listening to audiobooks that i already know that have positive plots. it's just enough stimulation to stop my brain from wandering.

singing along to music i know well. it helps regulate breathing & i can't get the words right if my brain is thinking about other things. also, exercise that requires my brain. i started doing ddr again recently & i have to focus on the arrows so my brain can't be thinking.

never underestimate the power of a supportive email. also, "i'm glad you reached out" is such an important phrase. as students, we often feel as though we shouldn't take up the time of faculty so statements that confirm that it was okay to reach out are incredibly helpful.

there is nothing like receiving a copy of someone's letter of recommendation for you when you are having a bad day. whenever possible, share letters of rec with the people you write them for. it can be very uplifting to see how others perceive you & your successes.
i don't think i've seen anything that represents my life in grad school as well as this!
and before people complain about needing to comment on someone's body to compliment them or whatever, just don't. there are so many ways to compliment someone without discussing their body.
let's make this simple: don't comment on people's bodies unless they ask you to. it's not that hard.

this week oscar has been enforcing sofa time. if i leave the sofa he gets mad & yells until i return. the left picture is after i told him i’d be right back. the right is the look i got when he followed me to the bathroom. i don’t think i’m allowed to leave the house again!

i do understand that, which is why i didn't complain at having to deal with this question at first. but since then i've completed a master's & 4 years of an md/phd program. i just feel that at some point a continued record of positive achievements should be sufficient!
manipulative & needy so really they're just being extra cat like. i hope that the little floof is feeling better & less violent!
i just had the same experience with the cat and his 7 day course of twice daily metoclorprimide. i would say it gets easier but that would be a lie. good luck and i hope that bun feels better soon!
very good point!
oof, that’s uncomfortable. sorry that happens and i hope that your previous pi has stopped doing that.

people share your f30 without asking?! i've asked to see other people's f30/f31s but i would never share them without checking first. that seems like the sort of thing you never share without permission.
yeah, we're almost at that stage too. it just seems a little ridiculous to give the cat his own tempurpedic seat cushion!
i wish i could just write that in response to my grant reviewers.
a surprising amount of places but in this case i'm referring to fellowship applications for predoctoral students. nih biosketch requirements include undergrad grades if you're a predoctoral student.

i know this isn't a new conversation but it bothers me every time. i understand needing to show improvement but i just can't grasp why once there is consistent improvement people still insist on being told why. isn't there a point where it just shouldn't matter any more?

at what point in my career will people stop asking me to justify undergrad grades? i don't think i owe anyone an explanation. i got a master's & was accepted to an md/phd program. my grades since have been great. i don't understand why grades from 10yr ago need justification!
apparently even more clever than we thought. that's my seat, with special cushions for my back while i'm working. he has taken it over & i'm certain he knows i won't make him move because he's sick.
and he knows we'll give in because we're worried about him. he's so manipulative!

this seat thieving cat has hyperthyroidism. the vet said until he gets treatment we should feed him whatever he wants whenever he wants, so he doesn’t lose any more weight. he has decided he’ll only eat lobster & the most expensive freeze dried salmon treats. he is ridiculous.
thank you! i'm glad that it resonated with others. i hope that there are future interviewers who consider some of these issues.

check out this really important piece from  about how we respond when others express feelings of wanting to end their own life. we need to be careful that our own responses don't further perpetuate stigma & reduce the chances that someone else will reach out for help.
glad you liked it!

as a medstudent this is an issue many of us have discussed & want to help change. there are many students not seeking necessary psych care because of fears about how it will affect licensing & job prospects. we need a system where trainees & physicians feel able to seek help.

as someone early in training in healthcare & ethics, i've spent a lot of time thinking about what i post, how it may be interpreted, & mistakes i may make. it helps to be reminded that most people feel that way. we need compassion & to be ready to be wrong & adjust accordingly.

the language we use to describe people & diseases can have significant effects on perceptions & behavior. in  i wrote about the dangers of using military metaphor to discuss the coronavirus & how it can contribute to risk-taking & stigma.
very good point, they didn't give me those numbers. i'll definitively ask, thank you!
yeah, based on his age and other health the costs are likely to be about the same over his lifetime. he sucks at pills but he also has major anxiety & freaks out badly at the vet.

cat question: oscar has just been diagnosed with hyperthyroidism. two treatment options: 1. radioiodine with a 98% cure rate, 4 day inpatient stay & isolation for a week. 2. x2 daily pills for life if you've had experience with either, i'd appreciate any insights.
this week i’ve learned that zoom calls after 6pm are not allowed. oscar sat next to me screaming & hitting me for almost the entire call (yes, video was on). as soon as the call ended he calmed down.
this is a review i didn’t realize i needed but am now very excited to read!
have some picture of these two trouble-makers!
tigger & oscar. adorable brothers who know just what to do to brighten my day.

yes! some of this goes back to what we were talking about wrt interviewers asking about traumas. i wrote something to summarize my thoughts on that discussion along with advice for interviewers who want to improve. let me know if you have other thoughts.

hi! not sure what type of writer i'd classify myself as, but i'm trying to write more & be part of the writingcommunity i have a blog of my md/phd experiences: https://tabithamoses.com/2016/07/15/mdphd-log/ i also have written about other ethics, science, & medicine topics: https://tabithamoses.com/blog/
i did this at the start of quarantine and it was the best decision i made. good choice!
the entirety of this quarantine has been cat savings time in my household.

i don’t want to give my cats any ideas with this gif. one of them already herds us to the sofa by nipping at our heels when he decides we need a rest. they are definitely very good at being in charge of enforcing self care.
one of the cats stole my wfh chair & the other has decided i’m his bed/masseuse. i guess there’s no use arguing, i’m just required to take a day off today. catsoftwitter
wow, was literally just talking/writing about this. i still don't understand how people/places think this is appropriate. i know it's probably well intentioned but still.
mine is pretty simple and not very update to date right now, but it's an example at least!

i need to send in a form that includes sensitive info. i asked how to send it. i was provided with a fax number that didn't work & then told that i could email the forms with the subject line "secure" to ensure they remained secure. is that really how the internet works?
this is specific for community organizations in mi that want to request naloxone. i have worked with a few already that wanted to distribute it but didn't know how to access it, so this is amazing!

recently we discussed how interviews should not force students to disclose or discuss traumatic events. i wrote about my experience & how we need to make sure this practice does not continue, especially in light of all the trauma people are currently experiencing. medtwitter
please don't  to explain expiration dates. i know. the whole point is that i recognize my behavior is irrational!
me: the expiration date on this jar of pickles was yesterday, i guess i can't eat them now. also me: this medication expired in 2012, i'm sure it's still good.

i'm currently writing 3 different pieces. despite the fact that they all have different word limits, each of them has about 20% more words than is allowed. i should not be spending more time getting under the word limit than i did writing the thing! why am i like this?!
yes! i’ve done this more times than i can count. or i get excited that the person i sent it to is finally editing it and then disappointed when i realize it’s just me.

a side effect of my browser tab problem: just because it looks like i am in a google doc doesn't mean i am actually looking at the document. apparently i've confused a few people who think i'm always working on the document or am just creepily watching them work.
i keep finding oscar sitting in a pan on the stove top. he’s really been channeling the anxieties & stresses of the world recently so frankly, this seems about right. catsoftwitter
another med student here!
yes, we are working on that now. the data presented here are part of a larger project that aims to identify the best method and time during medical education for this training.
this is always a fantastic session, full of great advice for those of us early in our careers. check it out now! cpdd20

the official "live" portion of our cpdd20 poster is over but i'm still happy to talk about our results! we have some really interesting data from our projects integrating  opioid overdose training into the med school curriculum. reach out if you have questions!
the first visitor to my virtual cpdd20 poster had some very loud criticisms of my work!
the benefit of the virtual cpdd20 poster session is that i can sit down & don’t have to balance food/drink in my hands. i do miss having poster neighbors to talk to though.

the response to covid19 has made it clear that there are plenty of ways that we can improve treatments & supports for people with suds. now we just need to continue these efforts & push for easier access to moud. cpdd20
those pictures made me ridiculously happy. the kittens definitely need to make a cameo in your presentation!
i really hope that there are going to be more conferencing with kittens photos!
the first cpdd20 poster session is today at noon! come check out our poster on the impact of an opioid overdose prevention & response training developed by  in first year medical students.
time for cpdd20! i may not be in the sun or by the beach but i am comfortably in my own living room & i can have tea/coffee & snacks whenever i want!
this is a really great aspect of the virtual conference. you can watch a lot of the content in your own time and go back and check out things that you missed. love that cpdd20 is doing this.
i'm doing the same thing! the conference chairs are very comfortable in my living room!
that's impressive! oscar likes to eat muffins & plastic so that would have been a good combo for him too. luckily, he hasn't learned how to open cabinets yet!
that's a good variety of veggies! russell clearly likes to have a balanced diet!
you mean poe doesn’t get his own plate of peanut butter? what a deprived cat!

happy caturday from oscar who is breaking about 50 different rules to get to the croissant. he is obsessed & can smell them from anywhere in the house. anyone else’s cats have weird foods they’re obsessed with?
check out this important piece from  about the effects of covid-19 on those who are incarcerated & the importance of ensuring that medical education addresses the needs of this vulnerable population.

unfortunately as far as i could tell the question was a test to see how well i held up under pressure so it didn’t seem like an had an option to decline to answer unless i wanted to “fail” the interview.

yeah, that's a major point i realized later. although it seemed messed up, it never seemed like the sort of thing to complain about or discuss with a program director b/c it just seemed like part of medical culture.
good point. at the time, i just accepted it as part of the culture of medical education, trial by fire so to speak, which is a pretty sad statement on how i viewed the culture of medical education.
my two caturday science buddies: tigger & oscar. not sure if you can see the arm of a chair in the bottom left of the photo but that’s my wfh chair. i have very dedicated supervisors.

this is especially important right now. black med students already have to deal with racism & significant disparities in medical training & these should not be exacerbated by forcing them to relive these experiences & traumas during already stressful interview situations. (3/3)

questions that require applicants to relive traumatic experiences for the purposes of "testing" them should not be acceptable. they demonstrate that the interviewer, and by extension the program, lacks empathy or any real understanding of the situation. (2/3)

of all my med school interviews i only remember one. in the, the interviewer's very first question (not even any pleasantries) was "so, how did your brother die?" i'm sure he thought it was a great way to see how i responded under pressure but it felt wildly inappropriate. (1/3)
question for usa based researchers: if your lab does in person human subjects research when do you plan to resume research activities?
huge thanks to  and , future bridesmaids and wonderful friends who helped make sure we still had a fantastic day!

this past weekend was our 10 year anniversary. it was also supposed to be our wedding day. like many others we had to postpone our wedding but we were lucky to still be able to celebrate each other with a few friends, a physically distanced picnic & a beautiful day.

staying quiet does not mean being silent. now is the time to amplify the voices of those who need to be heard. black voices. white people: we need to shut up. being called out for mistakes can sting, but this isn't about our feelings. listen, apologize, learn, & change.
yes, my partner uses a headset that works great for him. the only problem is that the cats have learned that if they meow into the mouthpiece they’ll get extra attention.

i really loved firecracker but perhaps it is too similar to anki for you. during neuro and for some of the biochem pathways i found https://www.drawittoknowit.com/ to be very helpful. other than that it was just lots and lots of practice questions & eventually some things sunk in.

i'll go first. it may be a little odd (especially since i don't normally watch the show) but when i'm feeling down i usually find that watching the voice auditions where all the judges turn can make me feel a little better.

there are a lot of reasons to feel down right now & sometimes it's hard to stay focused on the positive things. i thought we could start a thread of the little things that we do to feel better when we're not feeling great.
i was able to pet the wonderful fluffy belly for 5 full seconds before he captured me.
we may not remember what day it is but tigger remembers the importance of relaxation & i figured some of you might also appreciate some tigger zen in your day. quarantinecats
wow, even the grey patch over the eye is the same! magnoon appears to have oscar’s coloring and oscar’s brother’s physique.
oscar the hunter attempts to get his treats from the top shelf: a story in 3 pictures.

whoops, is 2016 considered out of date already? my white coat ceremony is the most recent decent professional looking photo i have so i still use it for everything. maybe i’ll update it when i eventually graduate.

the cat just had an hour long tantrum. meowing and meowing and meowing... why? well, i finally worked out the problem. i gave him tuna in broth for breakfast & he wanted the tuna with seaweed. he is calm now he has received his desired breakfast. this is my life now.

yeah, i have a poster and am feeling the same way about the registration fee for the online conference. i also need to find out if my institution will even reimburse the registration fees for a virtual conference.
“doctor, doctor, master” but don’t worry it’ll be another 50 yrs before i graduate so you have time to get it right

i’m incredibly grateful for the support of some great friends, who put up with me freaking out, tolerated a practice zoom presentation, & even delivered (contactless of course) delicious home made food.

despite all the chaos & not so good things going on i was able to completing my qualifying exam as scheduled & am now officially a phd candidate! special thanks go out to my partner who kept these two disruptive boys locked in the other room with him the entire time.
thank you! i couldn’t have done it without the support of the wonderful women of the tnp!
this is definitely going to give me nightmares.
thank you everyone for the advice, i really appreciate it! for anyone else who has zoom based presentations coming up there are some helpful tips in this thread.

i have my oral qualifying exam in a week & we are doing it via zoom. does anyone have any tips for trying to ensure things run as smoothly as possible via zoom? (i'll take any other advice related to quals as well! preparing is not going as well as i'd like)

i just had a meow-off with the cat that ended in me telling him i was no longer speaking to him & to go to his room. not sure what quarantine stage this is but i’m a little concerned about what comes next.
i don’t believe people when they tell me that. i’ve had these tabs for months, why would they be the problem now?
my 3,000 open tabs and i feel personally attacked by this.

for today’s perfectly normal problem, i am once again unable to work because tigger won’t let me use my chair. could anyone really be heartless enough to move this adorable fluffy belly? quarantinecats
well they’re not great at practicing social distancing but tigger & oscar have been doing a fantastic job at cuddling each other & reminding us to take nap breaks each day.
yeah, he is very used to being the boss of the household so he does not respond well to not getting his way.
i tried to explain that i have my qualifying exam in 2 weeks & need to work. this was his response. it’s perfectly reasonable to postpone something because the cat told you to, right? quarantinecats
i got up & he stole my seat. obviously now i can’t do any work today. quarantinecats

i have a specific chair that i’ve been using for working from home. obviously this means tigger has made that chair his new bed. today i kicked him off so i could join a lab meeting. this was my view for the entire meeting. quarantinecats
this is amazing! i missed the webinar so thank you for sharing the link!

i need an app that will pop up whenever i try to download a paper & tell me how many times i've already downloaded it without reading it. maybe there can be an add on where it will lock down my browser until i finally read the damn paper.
wait. people are actually wearing shoes while working from home all day? i barely wear shoes in my actual office, i am not doing that at home.
i feel seen. this month my tab problem has gotten out of hand. i now have 8 separate windows open, each with more tabs than i can count.
does anyone from  or  have an answer about their company policies on this?

exactly & when we cancel the delivery there is no way to provide a tip. but the person still drove all the way to the location & provided a service (even if it didn't end in the outcome we wanted) so i feel like there should be some way to ensure they are fully compensated.

question about delivery apps: a lot of places are not updating that they're closed on these apps. when we place orders the delivery person often goes to the restaurant & finds it closed. we then cancel the order. does the delivery person still get paid? can we still tip them?

officially made the decision to postpone our wedding. while i know there are far worse things happening right now and it is probably the right decision, that still doesn't stop it from feeling pretty crappy. this picture of our unofficial ring bearer helps a little though.
you eat the crumble with the red wine. then you have the apple cider for dessert.
we have a new spot on the sofa for today’s afternooncatnap but it is not as hot today so we are back to snuggling! quarantinecats
i've decided to start a band called "vector and the fomites" but i'm not sure what type of music we'll play.

i almost forgot to post today’s afternooncatnap because they didn’t snuggle in their usual spot, but don’t worry, i still have some sleepy cat pics. it was very warm in the apartment so i think everyone needed some space. quarantinecats
even these loving brothers fight sometimes. every time oscar tried to snuggle for afternooncatnap tigger kicked him off so tony had to step in and provide a human arm to snuggle with. quarantinecats

today is tuesday april 7. check your online classes to make sure nothing is due! it took me until 11:30pm yesterday to realize the day & date and then i had 30mins to start & finish my homework. don’t be like me.

oscar has been very vocally anxious lately so i am choosing to believe that tigger is comforting him in today’s afternooncatnap although it does like slightly like he is just trying to keep him quiet. quarantinecats

in an attempt to get myself into a productive mood, i have turned up the music & have been passionately singing along. then i realized the windows were open & i'm singing the heathers soundtrack. it's a good thing there aren't too many people outside right now.
in today’s afternooncatnap the boys remind us that we can practice some stretches while we sleep. quarantinecats
when you want to snuggle & have your adorable afternooncatnap but you also need your own space. quarantinecats
something empathetic, realizing that we might not all be able to work at our best right now and making it clear that that is okay.

psa: if you have friends/family who had some event (e.g. wedding) planned over the next few months, do not “check in” constantly to see if they are aware of what’s going on & ask whether they plan to cancel/reschedule. i promise you, they know & do not need your reminders.
one great way of making sure that someone stays inside is taking an afternooncatnap on their legs. oscar takes his new self-appointed wfh guard cat duties very seriously. quarantinecats

this is the same oscar who throws up to get attention so of course he has added a new layer of fun to his guard cat routine. now he throws up whenever my partner leaves the house. https://twitter.com/back2brains/status/1238515419247300613?s=21

we appear to have a self-appointed quarantine guard cat. the few times we’ve needed something from the outside my partner has gone in the morning before i get up. oscar does not approve of this. he yells until i’m awake & will not calm down until my partner’s back.
a beautiful sunny day still requires an afternooncatnap. they have an adorable pile of paws though. quarantinecats

everyone needs to watch this amazing video (with sound) that ⁦⁩ made with her cat namura while socially distancing this week. there is a strong possibility that i am just watching it on repeat right now. quarantinecats

they look very sweet during this afternooncatnap, don’t they? hard to believe that just an hr ago, while i was giving a zoom presentation, tigger was beating up his brother so loudly that everyone heard & my partner had to run in & pull tigger off his brother!quarantinecats
lovely to hear i can never tell if i’m just tweeting into a void of people who don’t appreciate very similar cat pics, so it’s nice to know some people are enjoying this thread!
i think oscar was dreaming of being superman in today’s afternooncatnap. these boys are definitely the superheroes of napping!quarantinecats
i respect your self-control but i think you owe it to yourself to open at least one of them.
this shouldn't even be a question. i don't understand why you haven't opened them already!

how about instead we all agree that no one does their hair or make up for video conferences? we need to lower the bar. if we're able to successfully show up to a video conference wearing semi-appropriate clothing & stay in frame when necessary i feel like that should be enough.

it may be a new week but we still need our afternooncatnap. today they’re on a freshly cleaned blanket. i realized i needed to move the blankets around each day so that you’d all believe that these pics were taken on different days! quarantinecats
oscar has been sad that we’re home all day & not paying him our full attention but tigger is trying to make him with their afternooncatnap and snuggles. quarantinecats
it’s caturday so obviously it’s time for another afternooncatnap. this one even includes a human! quarantinecats

a full week of afternooncatnap updates & some of you are only just realizing that i wasn’t kidding, i really do plan to update with a new picture every day. the boys are dedicated to their routine & it feels like my duty to share that with all of you! quarantinecats

me: i've been doing yoga & work out videos at home every day for 2 weeks now, why aren't i less anxious & more fit? also me: time to curl up with my costco box of chocolates, scroll through twitter for hours, & worry about everyone i know getting sick. quarantineactivities
we now run the dishwasher every day & i'm doing laundry every day too. no idea why we're doing so much laundry!

covid-19 is not like other diseases we expected to encounter in training, we still don't have all the info we need & the risks are not the same. healthcare workers are lacking protective equipment. we want to help, but please respect our concerns. (2/2)

dear med schools, when med students say they are concerned about the health of the high risk people they live with, telling them that this is one of the risks of being in medicine & it was always going to be a concern is not helpful nor is it completely truthful. (1/2)
guilt, tears, constant bombardment with messages to stay home. still not 100% effective but definitely doing better at staying home. good luck.
follow up: oscar is acting out because he wants attention & cuddles but only from my partner. this photo was taken 20mins later. quarantinecats
oh good, we have a new morning routine: a screaming cat sits where he’s not supposed to be & tries to set the apartment on fire. quarantinecats
1. server for a catering company 2. barnes & noble cashier/stock person 3. band manager 4. author manager & publicist 5. research & administrative coordinator 5 jobs & 5 tags
an important note that makes this even sadder is that normally when the 3 of us are hanging out he hides in the office!

as an introvert, social distancing isn't too terrible for me; however, my partner is really struggling. i was chatting with  &  on the phone & he came running in b/c he heard their voices, thought they were here & was so excited to see people!

back to our regularly scheduled afternooncatnap snuggles today. sometimes everything going on in the world is so tough that you just have to bury your head in your brother and have a good nap & that’s completely justified! quarantinecats

this is a fantastic resource for med students as well as others organizing covid-related volunteer efforts. there are links to sources of reliable medical information, guides for volunteering, and ways to help the community. definitely worth checking out! medstudenttwitter

i've just moved from the sofa to my working chair. this means i have graduated from scrolling through twitter on my phone to scrolling through twitter on my computer. plus, my posture is a little better.
caught in the act! and he screams while he does it. quarantinecats

week 2 of wfh: oscar learned that the stove beeps when he’s on it & he can turn off the childlock on the touchscreen oven. now, when he doesn’t get treats after screaming on his wheel, he moves to the stove. i just told him i’m sending him to live with grandma. quarantinecats
yes, i definitely need this group! https://twitter.com/back2brains/status/1242496732107362312?s=21

today’s afternooncatnap is a little different. tigger snuggled w/ me but oscar slept sadly at the door. social distancing is sad for oscar b/c his friends  &  stopped visiting almost every day. he waits by the door for them each night. quarantinecats
i got the cat wheel based on  recommendation (her cat actually uses hers properly) from

for everyone’s entertainment, i am sharing how bad i am at animal training. this is oscar & his cat wheel. oscar learned that the wheel gave him treats & he refuses to forget this. so, now he just sits on the wheel & screams whenever he wants treats. quarantinecats
almost forgot to post today’s afternooncatnap but don’t worry, the boys still stuck to their very important nap & snuggle schedule. quarantinecats
i miss seeing your cats at our ins committee meetings!
personally, that would improve any meeting i’m in. you have cats and toddlers. it’s the perfect combination for anyone not stuck at home with them 24/7!
heads up: if you tell me that you require me to have the video on for any videoconference/class then you need to be okay with my cats coming to say hello.
seriously! if i'd been the sort of teenager who snuck out of the house all the time & made her worry i would consider this reasonable payback but i didn't even do that!

i wish! she's in the uk so i can't get to her. she's occupying herself baking & gardening, which are apparently incredibly dangerous. she's currently building a cage to keep birds away from her seeds & got wire through the hand that's still healing from where she burned it...

if corona doesn't kill me, worrying about my mom will. she went to 6 grocery stores this weekend after i told her she was banned from going out. then, yesterday, she walked to the local store & got hit by a car (it was minor). why is she making it so hard to keep her alive?!
we are looking into the possibility of m3/m4s calling patients who tested negative to give them their results. students are also able to volunteer in the drive through testing sites.
it’s the start of a new week and the boys are continuing their afternooncatnap routine very adorably with the added bonus that tigger decided to share the blanket!quarantinecats
yeah, that was my thought too. maybe everyone is getting vr googles!

it’s been a long week & even the boys have been fighting. today’s afternooncatnap is a reminder that even when you’re upset with someone you can still show them love. tigger kicked oscar off the blanket but oscar stayed to cuddle his brother. quarantinecats
oh yeah, allergies plus just being indoors all the time & general dust buildup. it doesn't seem fair to still be getting seasonal allergies when we're not even going outside to enjoy the season!

is this chest tightness from corona or has the constant anxiety & stress caused my muscles to completely tense up? perhaps it's both. that would definitely be on brand for this year. i guess only time will tell.
i’m glad someone’s enjoying them, i’ve been taking these pictures everyday so i figured i might as well share them!
for saturday’s afternooncatnap the boys want to make sure they use every blanket in house. this makes sense because we just washed them so clearly they needed to be re-furred. quarantinecats
i love the side eye you’re getting for intruding on their adorable moment!

in an effort to prove how dedicated my cats are to routine & provide a pleasant interlude to your twitter scrolling i am introducing afternooncatnaps for the duration of social distancing. i will start with thursday’s photo & update with each day’s snuggle. quaratinecats

lol, i guess it’s good someone keeps us on a routine! partner likes to get up early to work and he and oscar have alone cuddle time after getting up so now oscar insists he gets up early so they can cuddle.

it’s only 1 week but the cats have already decided our routine. 5:30am: partner gets up 8:30am: i‘m awoken 11am: family breakfast 2pm-8pm: we’re allowed to work while cats rest 8pm: all working must stop 9:30pm: stetching 11:30pm: bed routine strictly enforced. quarantinecats
